content: Congratulations to Siyu (Calvin) and the team on the newly published paper in Digital Discovery! This exciting work on using LLMs for numerical property prediction is a perfect complement to our earlier Materials Today publication on LLMs for materials classification—great progress on both fronts!

I’m thrilled to share the fantastic news that Bo Hu has been awarded the prestigious Hong Kong PhD Fellowship Scheme (HKPFS) — the highest honor for incoming PhD students in Hong Kong! This is a remarkable achievement and a great start to his academic journey. Let’s all congratulate him on this well-deserved recognition!

Dr. Tongqi Wen delivered an invited lecture titled 'AI Atomic and Generative Models for Materials Science Research' at the Institute of Physics, Chinese Academy of Sciences. In his presentation, Dr. Wen introduced the latest advances in applying artificial intelligence to materials design, focusing on both small/large atomic models and large language models in materials science. He discussed applications of AI atomic models in defect properties of structural materials like nickel-based and titanium-based alloys, as well as recent work on large foundation atomic models covering 53 elements in the periodic table. Dr. Wen also explored materials-specific large language models developed based on general LLMs (GPT-4, Gemini-Pro, etc.), using prompt engineering techniques for materials property classification and prediction, and leveraging generative models combined with experiments for inverse materials design. The lecture was well-received by researchers and students from the Institute of Physics.
